title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox lost 4-1 to Yankees at Fenway Park, managing only two hits against New York's pitching.
Red Sox struggled offensively, going 0-for-8 with runners in scoring position and committing three errors.
Yankees held a 99.3% postseason chance, with Red Sox at 95.4%, emphasizing this series' playoff implications.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Deatrich Wise Jr., now with the Commanders, suffered a season-ending quad injury against the Packers.
Wise, 31, was injured while attempting to block an extra point and will require surgery.
Wise signed a one-year, $3.25 million contract with the Commanders after eight seasons with the Patriots.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early might start Tuesday against the Athletics at Fenway Park, following his impressive MLB debut.
Early struck out 11 A's batters in five scoreless innings, tying a Red Sox record for most strikeouts in a debut.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora will decide Sunday's pitching lineup, considering young talents Early, Payton Tolle, and Kyle Harrison.

title: Scott Boras says he, Alex Bregman are ‘waiting until the offseason’ before making opt-out decision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman and agent Scott Boras will decide on Red Sox contract opt-out after the 2025 season ends.
Bregman signed a three-year, $120 million contract with Boston, including opt-outs after the 2025 and 2026 seasons.
Red Sox president Sam Kennedy expressed desire for Bregman to stay, despite recent reports anticipating an opt-out.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Steve Martin, Martin Short, and Selena Gomez star in 'Only Murders in the Building' Season 5 on Hulu.
'Misery', a Rob Reiner-directed horror-thriller, is streaming on HBO Max featuring Kathy Bates' Oscar-winning performance.
'Warfare', co-directed by Ray Mendoza, depicts a 2006 Iraq mission, available now on HBO Max.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez, Keion White ruled out vs. Dolphins
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Cornerback Christian Gonzalez and defensive end Keion White ruled out for Patriots against Dolphins due to injuries.
Gonzalez's hamstring injury has sidelined him since July; White missed games due to illness.
Linebacker Marte Mapu and offensive tackle Morgan Moses are questionable ahead of Sunday's game.

title: With DC Terrell Williams out, who will be calling defensive plays for Patriots vs. Dolphins?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Zak Kuhr will call defensive plays for Patriots against Dolphins, replacing Terrell Williams due to health issues.
Kuhr, an inside linebackers coach, joined Patriots this season and previously coached at Ohio State and Titans.
Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel expressed confidence in Kuhr's preparation and play-calling ability for Sunday's game.

title: Boston activist Monica Cannon-Grant to plead guilty in federal fraud case
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Monica Cannon-Grant plans to plead guilty to federal fraud charges, canceling her October trial in Boston.
Charges involve defrauding donors, false statements on a mortgage, and fraudulent unemployment benefits claims.
Cannon-Grant and her late husband were originally indicted in 2022 for misuse of nonprofit funds.

title: Here’s what we know about Tyler Robinson, Charlie Kirk’s alleged assassin
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Tyler James Robinson, 22, from Washington, Utah, was arrested for the alleged murder of Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University.
Family members said Robinson became more political, viewing Kirk, a Trump ally, as a spreader of hate.
Robinson, an electrical apprentice at Dixie Technical College, acted alone and was detained without bail.

title: 7 things to know about a pivotal Red Sox-Yankees series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox and Yankees are competing for the top wild-card spot in the American League at Fenway Park.
Boston leads the season series against New York 8-2, with key performances by Trevor Story and pitchers Bello and Crochet.
Yankees rely on home runs, leading MLB with 249 homers, essential for their success given their .239 batting since August.
